record.title: NATIONAL HOMELESS YOUTH AWARENESS MONTH
record.narrative:
NATIONAL HOMELESS YOUTH AWARENESS MONTH -- (Senate - July 11, 2007)

[Page: S9057]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that the HELP Committee be discharged from further consideration of S. Res. 226 and that the Senate then proceed to its consideration.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
record.narrative: The clerk will report the resolution by title.
The legislative clerk read as follows:
A resolution (S. Res. 226) recognizing the month of November as "National Homeless Youth Awareness Month."
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the resolution.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that the amendment at the desk be considered and agreed to, the resolution, as amended, be agreed to, the preamble be agreed to, and the title amendment at the desk be agreed to; that the motions to reconsider be laid upon the table en bloc; and that any statements relating thereto be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The amendment (No. 2128) was agreed to, as follows:
On page 3 line 5 after "November," strike the period and insert "2007."
The resolution (S. Res. 226), as amended, was agreed to.
The amendment (No. 2129) was agreed to, as follows:
Recognizing the month of November 2007 as "National Homeless Youth Awareness Month".
The resolution, as amended, with its preamble, reads as follows:
record.narrative: (The resolution will be printed in a future edition of the Record.)
